entrance.title: Castle Entrance
entrance.description: The main entrance to the castle is decorated with a Renaissance portal. The original doors were replaced during reconstruction, but their historical elements were preserved.

hall.title: Main Hall
hall.description: The main hall of the castle was used for social events and meetings of the nobility. The ceiling is decorated with stucco ornaments, and a large crystal chandelier is located in the center of the room.

library.title: Library
library.description: The library contains valuable historical books and documents. The wooden shelves and table are original pieces of furniture from the 18th century.

bedroom.title: Bedroom
bedroom.description: The bedroom is furnished in 18th-century style with a large canopy bed and original Baroque furniture.

garden.title: Garden
garden.description: The castle garden is designed in an English style with many trees, shrubs, and flower beds. In the center is a fountain from the 19th century.

item1.title: 15th century
item1.text: On the site of today's castle, there was originally a larger log building that was destroyed by fire. It was probably a manor house.

item2.text: Due to the threat of Turkish invasions, the nobles rebuilt the tower manor into a large early Renaissance fortified castle.

item3.title: 16th - 17th century
item3.text: The architectural development of the castle culminated in Renaissance modifications, when the facade also acquired a typical red and white ornament with a natural pattern.

item4.title: 18th century
item4.text: The castle experienced a visit from Maria Theresa, Queen of the Habsburg dynasty. It was one of the most significant periods in the castle's history.

item5.title: 19th century
item5.text: The castle became the property of Adolf Schmitt's tannery company. The company gradually began to rebuild the castle and used the premises mainly for storing raw leather and fish fat.

item6.title: Early 20th century
item6.text: The castle burned down. The property was rented by entrepreneur Ján Salzberger, who tried to restore it.

item7.title: After World War II
item7.text: After nationalization, the castle was used as a school, music school, or warehouses. The communists wanted to use the castle as a tannery museum.

item8.text: Reconstruction began, which definitively ended after two years, and the building was abandoned again.

item9.text: The castle was purchased by local entrepreneur Ján Miškeje, who began its comprehensive reconstruction.

item10.text: A comprehensive reconstruction of the castle took place, which restored its historical value and beauty.
